name: places/ChIJt76oPPpYwokRR4Vj9oMB7EA
formattedAddress: 33 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 33 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Chic hotel with stylish rooms & suites, plus a trendy cocktail bar, a grill restaurant & a gym.

originalText.text: The only good thing about this place is the location otherwise the rooms are very old and in need of renovation. Definitely not worth the price that you pay. Filthy dirty carpets and upholstery in rooms. Hot water in the room is a gamble (had to change room because of this). We asked for a cot bed upon reservation and it was only brought to us without bed sheets after check in so our baby had to sleep in our bed for the first night. On a more positive note the concierge and cleaning staff were very nice.

text.text: The only good thing about this place is the location otherwise the rooms are very old and in need of renovation. Definitely not worth the price that you pay. We asked for a cot bed upon reservation and it was only brought to us without bed sheets after check in so our baby had to sleep in our bed for the first night. On a more positive note the concierge and cleaning staff were very nice.

originalText.text: Very minimalist in every way.  Very Small, very clean, no frills (no fridge, slow wifi, no free water bottles, etc) rooms.  If you just need a place to sleep then this place fits the bill.  Service is mediocre, I can into the hotel in the morning to simply coat check my back back while I roam the city and the first thing the front desk service person said to me was no check-in until 3pm.  Later that day, after checking-in, I asked the help desk if they had a plastic fork and knife.  They did not.  Like I said, no frills and minimalist in every way...

originalText.text: Fantastic location!! That’s the only reason we stayed there was because of the location. Walking to Rockefeller center, Central Park, multiple subway access points. Bed was comfy, I did wear socks when walking in the room- the carpet looked kinda gross. Nice little store in the lobby from check in. White Olive is the restaurant attached and menu looked good.

text.text: Fantastic location!! That’s the only reason we stayed there was because of the location. Walking to Rockefeller center, Central Park, multiple subway access points. Bed was comfy, I did wear socks when walking in the room- the carpet looked kinda gross. Nice little store in the lobby from check in. White Olive is the restaurant attached and menu looked good.

originalText.text: This was not what was advertised online at all. The carpet needs to be pulled up in the whole place and replaced - wear socks! The elevator was extremely small and I had vertigo after every ride. Only one super small trash can in the super small bathroom- and we had king bed room. The shower had 3 shower heads but the pressure was so hard that it hurt to shower. The shower door was not sealed so water splashed all outside of it and the shower floor flooded during every shower. The walls were dirty. The desk/dresser was dirty and the tapestry was coming apart from the bed frame. Though the bed and pillow were comfortable even though the blankets had stains on them. The service was AMAZING from the front desk, to the bellman and room service. The restaurant attached to the hotel was so good,be prepared to spend some money but definitely worth it. The location is on point if you want to be near the touristy area of the city. I will not be staying at this hotel again for $1000 for two nights. Disappointed.

The location is on point if you want to be near the touristy area of the city. I will not be staying at this hotel again for $1000 for two nights. Disappointed.

originalText.text: The hotel staff was extremely friendly, accommodating, and professional. The cleaning staff did a fabulous job cleaning and straightening our room every single day. The checking staff were great and the checkout experience was also great. The only thing I have to say is that the carpeting inside the hotel room was extremely dirty and the bottom of our socks got dirty from walking on the carpeting. The pictures of the hotel rooms make them seem bright and airy, however they were very dingy with dirty walls and the bathroom tub had been repaired and looked shoddy. The bathroom was extremely tiny. The beds were very comfortable. We had an interior room that overlooked another building. The room was small but not overcrowded with furniture.
